title: The Adventures of Hubert Alexander: The Baker and the Time Dough

story.text: Hubert Alexander wakes up in his quiet home, feeling an unusual surge of energy. As a devoted baker, he decides to experiment with a new dough recipe that includes a mysterious yeast he found in an old cookbook.

After baking his special dough into bread, Hubert notices strange phenomena: his watch and clocks around the house begin to speed up. Convinced it's linked to his baking, he suspects that this bread might have the power to manipulate time.

Hubert tests his theory by eating a slice of the bread before his work at the local bakery. To his astonishment, he's able to complete what would normally be hours of work in mere minutes, moving in a blur to the awe of his colleagues.

Emboldened by the effects, Hubert begins fine-tuning his recipe, keen to control this newfound power more precisely. He remains cautious, however, wary of any potentially harmful side effects that may not yet have surfaced.

As Hubert continues his experiments, he inadvertently discovers that the time-altering effects of the bread also reverse his aging. With each loaf, he appears younger, revitalizing his passion and energy.

The local news catches wind of Hubert’s unusually brisk bakery operations and begins an investigation. Fearing misuse of his discovery, Hubert contemplates destroying his recipe to prevent it from falling into the wrong hands.

After careful reflection, Hubert decides to share his secret—under strict conditions—with a trusted friend in the scientific community, hoping to harness the bread's power for the good of humanity, rather than personal gain.

ending: Hubert Alexander’s humble bakery became a secret hub of scientific and altruistic development, rewriting the very fabric of time from behind the counter of powdered flour and fresh bread.
moral: With great power comes great responsibility, and sometimes, the smallest of things can hold the mightiest of secrets.
